title: FDA will convene Digital Health Advisory Committee in November
description: In the past, DHAC meetings have focused on artificial intelligence and medical devices.
content: The Food and Drug Administration will convene a meeting of external digital health advisors on Nov. 6, according to an email reviewed by STAT. The gathering comes as the agency wrestles with myriad issues related to regulating artificial intelligence... [470 chars]

title: Apple sued by authors over use of books in AI training
description: Technology giant Apple was accused by authors in a lawsuit on Friday of illegally using their copyrighted books to help train its artificial intelligence systems, part of an expanding legal fight over protections for intellectual property in the AI era.
content:
Sign up here.
“Apple has not attempted to pay these authors for their contributions to this potentially lucrative venture,” according to the lawsuit, filed by authors Grady Hendrix and Jennifer Roberson.

title: Anthropic agrees to pay $1.5B US to settle author class action over AI training
description: Anthropic told a San Francisco federal judge on Friday that it has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit from a group of authors who accused the artificial intelligence company of using pirated copies of their books to train its AI chatbot, Claude, without permission.

title: Melania Trump Says Children Must Be Prepared For Artificial Intelligence
description: The first lady said Thursday during a White House event that "it is our duty to treat AI as we would our own children."
content:

First lady Melania Trump hosted a meeting on Tuesday of the White House Task Force on Artificial Intelligence Education and urged public and private leaders to help protect children from the dangers of the burgeoning technology.

title: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5B to settle lawsuit over pirated chatbot training material
description: The artificial intelligence company Anthropic has agreed to pay authors $3,000 per book in a landmark settlement over pirated chatbot training material.
content:
NEW YORK — Artificial intelligence company Anthropic has agreed to pay $1.5 billion to settle a class-action lawsuit by book authors who say the company took pirated copies of their works to train its chatbot.

title: U.S. AI giant Anthropic bars Chinese-owned entities
description: Anthropic is barring Chinese-run companies and organizations from using its artificial intelligence services, the U.S. tech giant said, as it toughened restrictions on "authoritarian regions." The startup, heavily backed by Amazon, is known for its Claude chatbot and positions itself as focused on AI safety and responsible development. Companies based…

title: Warner Bros sues Midjourney for AI-generated images of Superman, Bugs Bunny and other characters
description: Warner Bros is suing artificial intelligence company Midjourney for copyright infringement, alleging that the startup enables its millions of subscribers to create AI-generated images and videos of copyrighted characters like Superman and Bugs Bunny. It's the third big Hollywood studio to sue Midjourney in Los Angeles federal court after Disney…
content: Warner Bros is suing artificial intelligence company Midjourney for copyright infringement, alleging that the startup enables its millions of subscribers to create AI-generated images and videos of copyrighted characters like Superman and Bugs Bunny.... [3021 chars]
